title: A person sells an article at a profit of 12%. If he had purchased it for 12% less and sold it for Rs 9 less, he would have gained 27%. What is the original cost price of the article? - Quora
tags: SSC - Combined Higher Secondary Level Exam (CHSL)
Staff Selection Commission Combined Graduate Level Exam

response.answer_text: Let CP = Rs100, Profit 12%, SP = Rs 112. Again CP = Rs 88, Profit 27%, SP = 88 x 127/100 = 11176/100. Now, 1st SP - 2nd SP = 112 - 11176/100 = (11200–11176)/100 = 24/100. Hence 24/100 = 9 So, 100 = 9 x 100 x 100/24 = 3750 Original cost of the article = Rs 3750

Let original cost price is x Sale price is 1.12*x Purchase price is 0.88x Sale price is 1.12x-9 Sale price - cost price =profit (1.12x -9) - 0.88x=0.88x*0.27 0.24x-0.2376x=9 0.0024x=9 x=9/0.0024=Rs 3750 Verify Cost price is 3750* 0.88=Rs 3300 Sale price is 3750*1.12–9= Rs 4191 New sale price 3300*1.27=Rs 4191 Hence answer is correct.
C=Original Cost Price Sale Price=1.12C Reduced Cost Price=0.88C Reduced Sale Price=1.12C-9 = 0.88*1.27 C =1.1176 C 1.12C-1.1176C=9 0.0024*C=9 C=9/0.0024 = Rs 3750

Let, original cost price = p rupees. So, to make 12% profit; he would have sold it for (1.12 * p) rupees. Now, {(1.12) * p - 9} = (1 - 0.12) * p * (1 + 0.27) 1.12p - 9 = 0.88 * p * 1.27 1.12p - 9 = 1.1176p 0.0024p = 9 p = 3750. So, the answer is 3750 rupees.

Assuming the actual C.P.as x => S.P.=1.12x. If purchased at 12% less => the C.P. would be 0.88x selling it at Rs9.00 less=> new S.P. =(1.12x–9). Then profit would be (1.12x-9–0.88x)/(0.88x)=0.27.Solving it will get x as 0.24x-9=0.2376x or 0.0024x=9 or x=9/0.0024=90000/24=30000/8=Rs3750.00 Ans..
